title: Downloading emails
content: I have used Thunderbird on my laptop for years and have never had this problem before. until last week. Thunderbird will advise that there are, say, 6 emails to download but it wont down load them. I can access them from my Android tablet and see them on my email server). An initial check online suggested there might be a space problem on my laptop. There was, and I cleaned up the contents of my laptop. Problem disappeared. Today the problem reappeared. Thinking there could still be a space problem, I cleaned out my considerable archive in Thunderbird. Restarted Thunderbird - no luck. There were a dozen or so emails on the server, and I could read them on my Android tablet. I rebooted the laptop. A message that it was downloading new emails, but nothing downloaded although they were still on the server. I uninstalled Thunderbird and downloaded the latest version. I could email from the laptop to the Android and reverse but nothing else. I deleted all my emails on the server. Any suggestions about how I should proceed? Regards Alan Brooks
creator: alan.brooks

title: [TB Lightning] Oudated tasks: different behavior between release and ESR
content:
Hello,

I have noticed a difference in behavior (for some time now, but I haven't noted exactly which version: first half of the year) in the alert for tasks that are “oudated” but not “completed.”

On ESR, an outdated task continues to sound at the launch or from time to time. On release, an outdated task no longer sounds (it remains green in the list, but that's all). And we are no longer notified if we don't go and check.

I don't know if this behavior is intentional or if it's a bug, but personally I switched to ESR because it's too problematic for me to no longer have alerts on overdue tasks.

Please let me know what you think...

[To reproduce: create a task with a start time 5 minutes before your test, no end date, and a reminder 0 minute before].
creator: alexis.alloix

title: eliminare collegamento ad altro account
content: ho configurato un account xyz@abc.it - questo account è stato disabilitato dal gestore. Ma a questo account era collegato un altro account, nel senso che venivano rendirizzate le mail che arrivavano da 123@abc.it (stesso dominio). Ma io non ho più accesso ad entrambe le caselle. Ora quello che succede è che ogni tot minuti mi viene richiesto l'accesso al secondo account (123@abc.it) ma evidentemente la password è stata cambiata. Naturalmente non posso chiedere nulla all'amministratore del dominio. Non riesco a trovare il modo di eliminare questa richiesta per sempre (e non solo chiudendo ogni volta il pop-up che appare). Posso ancvhe eliminare l'account principale (xyz@abc.it), ma vorrei conservare tutta la posta. Ho provato a cambiare nome dell'account e nome del server, ma niente. Spero sia chiaro. Grazie

title: Thunderbird mails in lokale map
content: Bij een poging om thunderbird over te zetten op een nieuwe laptop merkte is dat bij het overzetten van het profiel de lokale mappen niet mee over gezet waren. Deze stonden op de oude laptop op een andere sectie van de SSD. In een poging om de lokale mappen me over te zetten op dezelfde manier als profiel, heb ik die mappen verplaatst naar post vak in, dit door met rechter muisknop op de map te kiezen voor "verplaats naar" Deze mappen kwamen ook onder post vak in en bleven ook onder lokale map staan, maar op beide lokaties waren ze leeg, geen mails. Uiteindelijk heb ik er wel terug mails in gekregen maar enkel deze tot 2018. In 2018 ben ik van outlook naar Thunderbird gestapt. Dus ik denk dat dit data van de back-up van outlook zal zijn. IS er ergens een bestand waar de meer recentere mails in staan, ik denk dat na 2018 geen backup gemaakt heb van thunderbird.
creator: dominiquevanoerle

title: Is compacting Maildir folders necessary?
content:
I'm trying to better understand how Thunderbird communicates that messages are deleted to the servers of the respective email accounts configured as IMAP. Specifically, it seems that when moving a message from an IMAP folder, such as an Inbox, to a folder of a different email account or a Local Folder, the message disappears from Thunderbird but doesn't immediately get deleted from the server (I am checking by logging in through a browser to the email's web interface). Depending on the email provider, it may be marked or flagged as "deleted" or in some cases it just remains in the inbox (in outlook's web interface, for example, I can't tell if a message has been marked as deleted or not). Only later, after right-clicking on the respective inbox in Thunderbird and choosing "Compact" it deletes the message from the server.

I'm a bit confused now: All of my accounts are using maildir (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/maildir-thunderbird) as storage format, which I selected prior to adding any account. According to the information here (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/compacting-folders), "Compact does not apply to accounts using the maildir storage format". So for maildir accounts, why do I have a "compact" option at all and how come it doesn't delete messages immediately? Or perhaps I'm misunderstanding either what compact means or maildir or (probably) both? Is there a way to have Thunderbird simply delete (not just "mark as deleted") moved messages instantly?

I was under the impression that since maildir stores essentially one file per email message, that it would function like file management on a computer, so when moving a message from folder A to folder B the file/message would disappear from folder A, not that it would keep a copy "marked as deleted" in folder A. If anybody could explain this I would be most grateful.
creator: jdhauck
